content.description: Begin under a crack system that runs up through a small overhang. Start with a delicate move to get set under the overhang. Then make a large move to get set to pull through the bulge. The fun isn't over till you hit that ledge, so buckle up.
content.location: It is just to the right of the top of the first approach trail.

content.description:
Begin up the right side of the face on technical crimps with a few good holds sprinkled in. As the route reaches the blank face, it trends left to meet up with

Miller Time

to work through the wild, exposed, left-leaning corner. Once through the corner, the route delicately tip-toes its way back and right along the bottom of the roof to the right to pull through and overlap before reaching the chains.
content.location: This is the rightmost route on the Memorial Wall which lies near the left end of the Magic Forest cliffband.

content.description:
Start by stepping off the ledge onto the left side of the

Puppies'

pillar. Make some delicate moves to get established under a bulge. Make a few long pulls on slightly tipped back terrain to get up and left through the bulge. Finish with easier climbing on the face to the anchors.
content.location:
It is on the left side of the

Puppies'

pillar and 40 feet uphill to the left of

Puppies

itself.

content.description:
The crux for me was around the whole top half, with the pump making the relatively easy moves at the top harder than they actually are.

This is a really cool route, vertical to maybe very slightly overhanging, on a free-standing column in a beautiful area. It is highly recommended.
content.location: Climb right in the middle of the face of the free standing pillar.

content.description: Paper Thin has steep, techy face climbing with a definite crux on great rock.
content.location:
It is just left of a tree on the smooth wall above the

Puppies' pillar

.

content.description:
While the final headwall climbs some nice rock, the moss and choss make this quite a compromise and is probably better skipped for most.

Just right of the classic

Puppies

arete, step off the reinforced stance on some chossy / mossy rock to reach a high first bolt. Continue up and right or try to stay left on better rock until a stance below the headwall. Using a large, hollow block, move left onto the headwall grabbing a sloping crimp rail where a juggy flake has recently broken making this section much harder. Continue up beautiful rock for the final few feet of climbing.
content.protection: 7 bolts. There is a quicklink currently on the bolt above the chossy block.
content.location:
This is just right of the

Puppies

/

Kittens...

arete starting in mossy rock.

content.description: The route begins up the obvious crack system of the Memorial Wall with vertical, technical climbing on mostly big holds. Get set under the left-leaning corner, and bust up and left through the airy corner to get set under the large, obvious roof. From here, make a few challenging moves to get set right at the base of the roof, then make the roof pull on some large holds and a wild sequence. This is powerful, technical, and fun!
content.location: This is the middle route on the Memorial Wall (which is near the left end of the Magic Forest cliffband).

content.description:
Start on the right side of the

Puppies'

pillar. Follow the arete with your left hand all the way to the top. This has some amazing arete climbing on it requiring good body position, balance, and some power too. It is not quite as steep as its neighbor, but it is also very fun!
content.location:
It shares the same first bolt as

Puppies

and climbs the right side of the arete.
